answerText: chlorophyll[10] This set of proteins contains a single chlorophyll molecule at its center, which is fed energy by antenna complexes. This photosystem transfers energy to plastoquinone and cytochrome b6f.
heading: VCU Closed  |2013 | Columbia A + Ottawa  | 7 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In 2010, scientists discovered the f type of this compound present in the cyanobacteria filaments of stromatolites. For ten points each: [10] Name this porphyrin-containing compound more commonly found in a and b varieties. It is required for photosynthesis and contains a magnesium atom in its center.
